Those installed by default are in Main (officially supported) Ubuntu repository.
For information about the Ubuntu repositories see <nowiki>[[Repositories]]</nowiki>. Clicking on the icon next a program should take you to information about the Ubuntu package.

=== Medicine ===

* <nowiki>[[AstronautVistA]]</nowiki> - A CCHIT-approved comprehensive electronic medical record system, based on the US Veterans Administration EHR system. Specific installation instructions for Ubuntu/Kubuntu are <nowiki>[[AstronautVistA|here]]</nowiki>.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.debian.org/devel/debian-med/|Debian-med]]</nowiki> - A set of metapackages that Ubuntu inherits from Debian for medical practice and research.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.dcm4che.org/confluence/display/ee2/Installation|dcm4chee]]</nowiki> - A robust DICOM image and PACS server that runs within the JBoss (Java) Application Server framework.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.nongnu.org/aeskulap/|Aeskulap]]</nowiki> - A medical image viewer.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.orcero.org/irbis/kradview/|kradview]]</nowiki> - DICOM viewer.

* <nowiki>[[http://opendicom.sourceforge.net/|openDICOM.NET]]</nowiki> - DICOM imaging software.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.gnumed.org/|GNUmed]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/gnumed-common|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - Medical practice software.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.openclinica.org/|OpenClinica]]</nowiki> - A web-based Clinical Data Management Software (CDMS) platform for managing multi-site clinical research studies.
